The Chapter of Yudhañjaya🔽The Perfection of Truthfulness
The Story of Sutasoma
“Then again, when I was
Sutasoma, lord of the earth,
Seized by Porisāda,
I was brought to the brahmin in battle.

analyzed: khattiyānam eka sata  āvuṇitvā karat tale
translated: A hundred nobles🔽were bound by their wrists,
and after they were killed,
they brought me to the sacrifice.
Porisāda asked me,
‘What do you want as a ransom?
I will do as you wish,
if you return to me.’
Having agreed to his question,
my return,
I went to the delightful city
and gave up the kingdom at that time.

analyzed: anussaritvā satam dhamma  pubbakam jina sevita
translated: Remembering the hundred dharmas,🔽followed by the Victorious One,
I gave wealth to the brahmin
and approached Porisāda.
There was no doubt in me,
whether he would kill or not;

analyzed: sacca vācā anurakkhantaḥ  jīvitam cajitum upāgami
translated: Upholding the word of truth,🔽I approached giving up my life.
There is no one equal to me in truthfulness,
This is my perfection of truthfulness.”
The twelfth story, of Sutasoma.
